storyInfo: The Doctor begins to understand the rules of Terran warfare, and witnesses the disintegration of an Infected for the first time.

attributes.content: Look! Up ahead!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Civilian

attributes.content: The bridge... it's been blown? How are we supposed to get across?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Civilian

attributes.content: I-Is there another path? The Catastrophe cloud is still over our heads...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Civilian

attributes.content: We can't go any further, not with all the wounded and children...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Civilian

attributes.content: Damn, the Originium crystals on the ground are starting to glow...
attributes.name: Babel Member
Babel Member
attributes.content: They'll kill us before the Catastrophe even has a chance.

attributes.name: Babel Member
attributes.content: *cough*
attributes.joined: They'll kill us before the Catastrophe even has a chance.*cough*

attributes.name: Babel Member
attributes.content: We need to—

attributes.name: Babel Member
attributes.content: *cough*—

attributes.name: Babel Member
attributes.content: *cough* *cough*—
We need to go... It's all *Sarkaz expletive* Originium particles in the air.
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: No medicine for more than a week now... all the injured... Infected... damn it!
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: Wh-What's that sound?
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: No reinforcements from Babel yet? Then keep looking for a path! Don't come back until you do!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: The Catastrophe cloud's fully formed. Which *Sarkaz expletive* unit attacked the hospital? Not even Scareye's that crazy!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Stick together! It's too late to try to get out of the Catastrophe. We need to find some clean caves! Nothing with Originium traces on it, not even a little bit!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Doing this to the wounded... Theresis, you piece of...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Mom... my leg hurts...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Child

attributes.content: Don't cry, don't cry... we're almost home...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Civilian
Sarkaz Child
attributes.content: No— no—

attributes.name: Sarkaz Child
attributes.content: It hurts— It hurts...
The sound of children crying.
The sound of conspiracy, of death, of struggling to survive.
The Catastrophe is deaf to all that, turning wind and snow into storm.
A few figures stand on a distant cliff.
The woman stands on the edge, peering silently into the distance.
A merciless Catastrophe, enemy soldiers blocking key passages, fleeing beasts, and the wounded and civilians with nowhere to run.
Life echoes in the valley, reaching Mantra's ears.
It is the sound of children crying.
...I hear it.
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: Children are crying.
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: It's starting to snow. This isn't good.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Two thousand, three hundred and thirteen.
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: All confirmed.
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: Location and physical data logged.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Fewer losses than expected, but time's of the essence.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Watching your Arts up close is always a remarkable experience, Mantra.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: (Nods humbly)
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: Was the Djall in HR able to get you a few assistants?
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: (Closes eyes)
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: A shame.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Message sent to all squads.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Cave, seven kilometers to the northeast.
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: The children are there.
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: But the Military Commission's drones have found us.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: I'll stay. You go.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: (Frowns)
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: They don't want to face my squad head-on in this terrain.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Just going to say hi. Will try to take Manfred alive if he's leading them.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Don't take unnecessary risks—
attributes.name: Mantra

attributes.content: Doctor here.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Sorry I'm late. Operations in the CA area have concluded.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Continue to carry out Mantra's plan. I'll provide support elsewhere. The priority is to help the civilians and wounded.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Good timing, Doctor.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Thanks. Misery is distracting the Military Commission, but he needs help.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Is this the part where I volunteer?
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Yes, Ace.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Awaiting your orders.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: And...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Theresa will go directly to the affected field hospital at the center to prevent further casualties.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: If all goes well... I'll meet you there.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Explosion! Explosion!
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: Move away from the glowing area! Back off! The Originium underground is being activated—
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: *Sarkaz expletive* Too late—
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: Fires stir beneath the frozen earth, and blizzard brings with it the sparks of Catastrophe.
Every breath seems to carry the weight of all of Terra, bringing it upon every individual soul.
The weight vanishes in an instant.
They look up to see an astonishing sight.

attributes.name: Babel Member
attributes.content: Gah—

attributes.name: Babel Member
attributes.content: ...The explosions stopped?
Snow... floating in the air?
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: The snow crystals here are almost indistinguishable from Originium crystals. Control over them can be achieved with sufficient focus.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: You... You're
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: Precise control over individual snowflakes is difficult, but it's not so difficult to hold a snowstorm off in an Originium-rich environment.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: Have you been paying attention in class, Aidan?
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: Pith! You're here! You...
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: I can give you ten minutes.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: Go back to the meadows at the bottom of the valley and head south. Scout will guide your path.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: Don't you remember what I taught you? There are a lot of emergency precautions you can take in an Originium-dense environment, but you did nothing.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: Wait... you have acute Oripathy patients in your group! What were you thinking?!
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: Take this syringe! I'll do what I can. You have ten minutes to get everybody in order.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: But you—
attributes.name: Babel Member

attributes.content: Move it, before the Catastrophe fully forms! This area will be safe while I can dampen it for a bit.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: —One more thing.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: I'm using several kinds of Arts at the same time right now. I want to see an essay from all of you on my table by this weekend, explaining which schools these Arts belong to.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: So you better damn well make it out alive.
attributes.name: Pith

attributes.content: ...It's me. Any instructions from Manfred?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: What is he doing? Huh?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: A Royal Court high rank in amongst the Babel forces and refugees? Impossible! Look it up!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: Doubt there's anything to look up. Manfred probably made up the excuse on the spot.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary B

attributes.content: Even if they were there, they're Babel prisoners now. Rescuing prisoners in the middle of a Catastrophe is not part of the contract.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary B

attributes.content: But we have to do it anyway. Dammit, get Thorn Squad to check the blockade...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: Alright... 86 here. Hello? Hello?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary B

attributes.content: No response. Where did they go? It's not time for the shift change yet, is it?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary B

attributes.content: ...Wait.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary B

attributes.content: Isn't it a little too quiet?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary B

attributes.content: There were fowlbeast cries only a moment ago...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary B

attributes.content: All the animals must have fled the Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: It'll sweep through this place in five hours. This is no time to be taking a nap.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: Hand me the schedule.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: I said, hand me the—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: Huh? Hey, where did you go?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: Hello? This is Squad 86! Anyone hear me? Anybody? What's going on? Somebody's—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary A

attributes.content: You called?
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Phew.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Three squads silenced. No alerts. The path is clear.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Combat personnel, follow these coordinates. Medics, take the injured and follow the markings I've left.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: ...There's something I need to confirm.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: It's the Military Commission's frequency alright, but these were scouts, not the rogue mercenaries that attacked our positions.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Mission briefing 'Strawberry'. Just monitoring the retreat of the civilians... hah, Manfred even lied to them that there was a 'Royal Court high rank' here.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Well, I guess I'll leave the rest to Ascalon.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Babel.
attributes.name: Mysterious Mercenary

attributes.content: Are you my death?
attributes.name: Mysterious Mercenary

attributes.content: You led the attack on Babel positions. Who's orders are you following?
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: It's just doctors and Infected civilians—
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The sword comes before she can finish her sentence.
Something feels out of place.
But Ascalon adjusts quickly. She has always been more familiar with the language of violence anyway.
The sleeve-blade is out of its sheath.
Ngh.
attributes.name: Mysterious Mercenary

attributes.content: What are you—
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Bomb... you're crazy.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Surrender. You have no chan—
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: ...It's me. I'm done.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Sorry, couldn't take him alive. He blew himself up.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Something's not right.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: He recognized me as Babel immediately, realized he was no match for me and quickly chose to blow himself up.
attributes.name: Ascalon
Ascalon
attributes.content: Abnormally decisive. Could be some experienced spy, or...

attributes.name: Ascalon
attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.joined: Abnormally decisive. Could be some experienced spy, or...Wait.

attributes.content: I found a pouch. It's undamaged. I must have cut it off.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: There's a Babel sleeve badge and a Military Commission medal inside.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: It's not unusual for a mercenary working both sides of a war.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: And a piece of paper. Possibly personal notes.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Most of it is illegible. The only thing I can make out is...
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: '...del. Home.'
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Forget it. Not important.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Communications are out? Well, I guess the old stuff won't do it when a Catastrophe is so close.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Let's hope the other teams found a way out.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Don't just stand there.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Bring all the Infected who can't move over here.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: What's the point? It's not like they'll be able to get away from the Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Just do it. It's not like you have anything to lose, is there?
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: And...? Some of them are comatose.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: My condition isn't that far off from theirs. I'll end their suffering.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: Originium particles will spread when they die. I'll take the brunt of it. Take your bow, keep your distance, and finish the job.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: (Mumbles) Hell no.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Hey, stay away from the Infected. Julie will deal with them.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: ...Infected.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You're just leaving them here like firewood.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I'm not doing it because I want to.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Is there any hope for them?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: No. Just death. They'll turn to dust in ten minutes or so.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: They could have been saved.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Does living a little longer count as being saved?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Their conditions are too severe. If they don't die here, they'll die in some forgotten alleyway in Kazdel. I should have stayed in Sargon...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Here, give them these suppressants. It'll at least relieve their pain.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Where did you get these suppressants? No, who are you anyway? When did you get here?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Don't move!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Your ID code, now, or I'll—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Let the Doctor pass.
It's fine.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Everything will be fine.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You look familiar—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Y-Your Highness! How could you—
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: We're right in the middle of the Catastrophe! W-We're very grateful, but...
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: You shouldn't have come! It's too dangerous—
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: The white Sarkaz appears on the battlefield without a sound, as though she has come out of nowhere.
The crowd whispers amongst themselves. Is she truly the King of Babel, one of the living Six Heroes, the mother of Kazdel?
Theresa simply nods at confused and bewildered crowd.
She kneels by the side of the Infected.
Your... Highness...
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: I'm sorry I came late.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Too late to save your lives... I'm sorry I couldn't do enough...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Please... don't...
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: Theresa gently holds his hand in hers.
The other Infected, all the ones still conscious, those who have not fully given up on living, feel a little bit of gentle warmth.
I'm listening, my children.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I will remember how all of you lived and died... forgive me that I could not promise you more, but for your family, children, friends and comrades...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: There will come a day when they will no longer live in fear.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your lives should have been so much more.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Now, though, dream a warm dream... a dream that will come true.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Sleep, children of Kazdel. Sleep in the warm embrace of home.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Sleep.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Thank... you...
attributes.name: Dying Infected

attributes.content: The Infected begin to glow with the colors of Originium.
Tiny stones eat away at flesh and blood, transforming their lives and desires into fleeting sparks.
Theresa holds their hands to the end.
Until shining dust rises towards the sky and is scattered by the wind, never to become stars upon the heavens.
So, you... er...
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: You can call me anything you like. Even 'evil spirit', if that's what you prefer.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I-I don't mean that! It's just, this is the first time we've spoken to each other alone.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: You brought us many victories. I've had a hand in some. They also say you're an expert on Originium...
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: ...'Expert'.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Yet it's the first time I've seen Infected die like this with my own two eyes.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You're lucky.
attributes.name: Julie

attributes.content: I never thought it would be so...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Does living a little longer count as being saved?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: ...Never mind.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: It's time to go, Theresa.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Right.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But it's too late, even if we leave now. And the Military Commission has set a trap for us...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: It'll be fine.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Let's go home.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Military Commission's after-action report writes:
'The King of Babel and her most trusted men led her people out of the valley.
'With a single touch she parted wind, snow, and flames, gentle as a mother parts the bed curtains to put her child to sleep.
'Our casters and crossbowmen observed the procession, but none dared take the first shot, nor give the order to.'
The flowery report and Manfred's 'false intelligence' earned an admonition from the Commission, but no further discipline.
Doctor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I heard about the operation. You...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Doctor?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There's something I want to ask, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: As a physician, is it saving a life when all you can do is stave off death for a little while?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Unless it goes contrary to the patient's wishes, the duty of a physician is to save lives.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That's what we've always worked to do.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Why do you ask?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Looking at Amiya and the people around us makes me feel that you shouldn't have to deal with this kind of suffering.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: And I...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Doctor, Kal'tsit, there you are.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The intelligence meeting just ended. The unexpected Catastrophe has led to a stalemate, and some breathing room for us.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The two of you need to get some rest. Especially you, Doctor. You've hardly slept since you've been back, right?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I'm fine...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Theresa glances at Kal'tsit, who seems to sigh wordlessly with her eyes.
The King of Sarkaz senses guilt and restlessness. It is not an easy thing to accept, watching so many Infected turn to dust before one's eyes.
Doctor... do you think all this is your fault?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It is.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I won't run from my responsibility, and I won't wallow in self-pity... I just need time to accept the present.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.text: I don't know if Originium is supposed to hurt a newborn civilization like this.
<color=#000000>But Originium is the only way to protect all life and existence.</color>

attributes.content: You're tired, Doctor. I'm grateful that you have chosen to bear the burden of these emotions for the sake of this great land.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your pain and struggle shows your kindness and ideals. I won't try to wipe them away, but we could share this burden, if you are willing...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Theresa wants to hold the Doctor's hand, perceive the Doctor's guilt- and anxiety-filled soul.
She wants to help the Doctor.
But a tiny speck of noise echoes ominously in the King's mind.
(The Doctor is rejecting me? Or is it...?)
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Sorry, Theresa, but this is not something you need to take on.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: No need to use Civilight Eterna on me. It takes a toll on you too. There are more important uses for it.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: More important than helping someone who's given everything for us?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Hehe... thank you. I mean it.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You and Scout said we have some breathing room, right?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I'll make dinner for us, then. I learned it off Misery.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: For our future challenges.
attributes.name: Doctor
